refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITUND liefert das Ergebnis der bitweisen UND-Verknüpfung der übergebenen Argumente.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Die BITSCHIEBEL Funktion liefert das Ergebnis der Bitschiebe-Operation auf @x um @n Bits nach links.
* Falls @n negativ ist, wird eine Bitschiebe-Operation nach rechts durchgeführt.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITODER liefert das Ergebnis der bitweisen ODER-Verknüpfung der übergebenen Argumente.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Die BITSCHIEBER Funktion liefert das Ergebnis der Bitschiebe-Operation auf @x um @n Bits nach rechts.
* Falls @n negativ ist, wird eine Bitschiebe-Operation nach links durchgeführt.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BITXODER liefert das Ergebnis der bitweisen exklusiven ODER-Verknüpfung der übergebenen Argumente.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: KOMPLEX liefert eine komplexe Zahl der Form x + yi.
@Reel ist der reelle und @Imaginär der imaginäre Koeffizient der komplexen Zahl. @Suffix ist der Suffix des imaginären Koeffizienten.
* Falls @Suffix weder 'i' noch 'j' ist, liefert KOMPLEX einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMABS liefert den absoluten Betrag einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMAGINÄR liefert den imaginären Teil einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMAGINÄR einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCCOS liefert den komplexen Arcus Cosinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl. Die Branch-Cuts liegen auf der reelen Achse, unterhalb von -1 und oberhalb von 1.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCCOS einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCCOSINHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Arcus Cosinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl. Der Branch-Cut liegt auf der reelen Achse, kleiner 1.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCCOSINHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCCOTAN liefert den komplexen Arcus Cotangens einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCCOTAN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCCOTHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Arcus Tangens der Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCCOTHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCKOSEK liefert die komplexe Arcus Kosekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCKOSEK einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCKOSEKHYP liefert die komplexe hyperbolische Arcus Kosekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCKOSEKHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCSEK liefert die komplexe Arcus Sekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCSEK einen #WERT-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCSEKHYP liefert die komplexe hyperbolische Arcus Sekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCSEKHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCSIN liefert den komplexen Arcus Sinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl. Die Branch-Cuts liegen auf der reelen Achse, unterhalb von -1 und oberhalb von 1.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCSIN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCSINHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Arcus Sinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl. Die Branch-Cuts liegen auf der imaginären Achse, unterhalb von -i und oberhalb von i.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCSINHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCTAN liefert den komplexen Arcus Tangens einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl. Die Branch-Cuts liegen auf der imaginären Achse, unterhalb von -i und oberhalb von i.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCTAN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARCTANHYP liefert den hyperbolischen Arcus Tangens einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl. Die Branch-Cuts liegen auf der reelen Achse, unterhalb von -1 und oberhalb von 1.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARCTANHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMARGUMENT liefert das Argument Theta einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl, also den Winkel im Gradmaß zwischen der reelen Achse und der Darstellung der Zahl in Polarkoordinaten.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMARGUMENT einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMKONJUGIERTE liefert das komplexe Konjugierte einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMKONJUGIERTE einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMCOS liefert den Cosinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMCOS einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMCOSHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Cosinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl, wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMCOSHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMCOTAN liefert den komplexen Cotangens einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMCOTAN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMCOTANHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Cotangens einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMCOTANHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMKOSEK liefert die komplexe Kosekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert #IMKOSEK einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMKOSEKHYP liefert die komplexe hyperbolische Kosekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMKOSEKHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMDIV liefert den Quotienten zweier komplexer Zahlen @iZahl1 und @iZahl2.
* Falls @iZahl1 oder @iZahl2 keine gültige komplexen Zahlen ist, liefert IMDIV einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMEXP liefert das Exponential einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMEXP einen #WERT!-Fehler..

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMINV liefert die Inverse, oder Reziproke, einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMINV einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMLN liefert den natürlichen Logarithmus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.

Das Ergebnis hat einen imaginären Teil zwischen - und + PI. Der natürliche Logarithmus ist für komplexe Zahlen nicht eindeutig definiert. Möglicherweise müssen Sie eine gerade Vielfache von PI vom imaginären Teil abziehen.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMLN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMLOG10 liefert den Logarithmus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl zur Basis 10.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMLOG10 einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMLOG2 liefert den Logarithmus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl zur Basis 2.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMLOG2 einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMNEG liefert das negative einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMNEG einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMPOTENZ liefert eine komplexe Zahl @iZahl1, potenziert mit einer anderen Zahl @iZahl2.
@iZahl1 ist die komplexe, zu potenzierende Zahl und @iZahl2 ist die Zahl, mit der sie potenziert werden soll..
* Falls @iZahl1 oder @iZahl2 keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMPOTENZ einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMPRODUKT liefert das Produkt der angegebenen komplexen Zahlen.
* Falls eine @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMPRODUKT einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMREEL liefert den reellen Teil einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMREEL einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMSEK liefert die komplexe Sekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMSEK einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMSEKHYP liefert die komplexe hyperbolische Sekante einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMSEKHYP einen #WERT-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMSIN liefert den Sinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMSIN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMSINHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Sinus einer komplexen Zahl z (@iZahl), wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMSINHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMWURZEL liefert die Quadratwurzel einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMWURZEL einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMDIFFERENZ liefert die Differenz zweier komplexer Zahlen @iZahl1 und @iZahl2.
* Falls @iZahl1 oder @iZahl2 keine komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMDIFFERENZ einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMSUMME liefert die Summe zweier komplexer Zahlen @iZahl1 und @iZahl2.
* Falls @iZahl1 oder @iZahl2 keine komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMSUMME einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMTAN liefert den Cosinus einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl.
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMTAN einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IMTANHYP liefert den komplexen hyperbolischen Tangens einer komplexen Zahl @iZahl, wobei
* Falls @iZahl keine gültige komplexe Zahl ist, liefert IMTANHYP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DAVERAGE function returns the average of the values in a list or database that match conditions specified.
@database is a range of cells in which rows of related information are records and columns of data are fields. The first row of a database contains labels for each column.

@field specifies which column is used in the function. If @field is an integer, for example 2, the second column is used. Field can also be the label of a column. For example, ``Age'' refers to the column with the label ``Age'' in @database range.

@criteria is the range of cells which contains the specified conditions. The first row of a @criteria should contain the labels of the fields for which the criteria are for. Cells below the labels specify conditions, for example, ``>3'' or ``<9''. Equality condition can be given simply by specifying a value, e.g. ``3'' or ``John''.

Each row in @criteria specifies a separate condition. If a row in @database matches a row in @criteria, then that row is counted. Technically speaking, this a boolean OR operation between the rows in @criteria.

If @criteria specifies more than one column, then each of the conditions in the specified columns must be true for the row in @database to match. Technically speaking, this is a boolean AND operation between the columns in @criteria.

refsect1.para: Let us assume that the range A1:C7 contain the following values:
In addition, the cells A9:B11 contain the following values:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DVARP function returns the variance of a population based on the entire populations. The populations consists of numbers that match conditions specified.
@database is a range of cells in which rows of related information are records and columns of data are fields. The first row of a database contains labels for each column.

@field specifies which column is used in the function. If @field is an integer, for example 2, the second column is used. Field can also be the label of a column. For example, ``Age'' refers to the column with the label ``Age'' in @database range.

@criteria is the range of cells which contains the specified conditions. The first row of a @criteria should contain the labels of the fields for which the criteria are for. Cells below the labels specify conditions, for example, ``>3'' or ``<9''. Equality condition can be given simply by specifying a value, e.g. ``3'' or ``John''.

Each row in @criteria specifies a separate condition. If a row in @database matches a row in @criteria, then that row is counted. Technically speaking, this a boolean OR operation between the rows in @criteria.

If @criteria specifies more than one column, then each of the conditions in the specified columns must be true for the row in @database to match. Technically speaking, this is a boolean AND operation between the columns in @criteria.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Let us assume that the range A1:C7 contain the following values:
In addition, the cells A9:B11 contain the following values:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PIVOTDATEN.ZUORNEN holt Summendaten aus einer Pivottabelle. @Pivot_Tabelle ist ein Zellbereich, der die Pivottabelle enthält. @Feldname ist der Name des Feldes, von dem die Zusammenfassungsdaten berechnet werden sollen.
* Falls keine Summendaten verfügbar sind, liefert PIVOTDATENZUORNEN einen #BEZUG!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DATUM berechnet die Tage seit dem 1. Januar 1900 (die Datumsseriennummer) für das angegebene Jahr, den angegebenen Monat und Tag.
* Falls @Monat < 1 oder > 12 ist, wird das Jahr angepasst. Eine ähnliche Anpassung findet für Tage statt.
* @Jahr sollte mindestens 1900 sein. Falls @Jahr < 1900 ist, wird 1900 + @Jahr angenommen.
* Falls das angegebene Datum ungültig ist, liefert DATUM einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DATUMINUNIX konvertiert eine für die Tabellenkalkulation lesbare Datums- und Zeit-Seriennummer in das Unix-Zeitformat.
* Die Unix-Zeit ist die Anzahl der Sekunden seit Mitternacht des 1. Januars 1970.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DATEDIF liefert die Differenz zwischen zwei Daten. @Intervall ist einer der sechs folgenden möglichen Werte:
Die ersten drei Möglichkeiten liefern jeweils die Anzahl ganzer Jahre, Monate oder Tage zwischen den beiden angegebenen Daten.
"ym" liefert die Anzahl ganzer Monate zwischen den beiden Daten, ohne Berücksichtigung der Differenz in Jahren.
"md" liefert die Anzahl ganzer Tage zwischen den beiden Daten, ohne Berücksichtigung der Differenz in Monaten.
"yd" liefert die Anzahl ganzer Tage zwischen den beiden Daten, ohne Berücksichtigung der Differenz in Jahren.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DATWERT liefert die Seriennummer des Datums. @Datum_Zeichenkette ist die Zeichenkette, die das Datum enthält. Der Wert hängt von der Datumskonvention ab. Die MS Excel 1900-Konvention zählt Daten vom 1. Januar 1900 an, wohingegen die 1904-Konvention den 1. Januar 1904 verwendet.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TAG konvertiert eine Seriennummer in den Tag eines Monats.
* Beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DAYS360 returns the number of days from @date1 to @date2 following a 360-day calendar in which all months are assumed to have 30 days.
* If @method is 1, the European method will be used. In this case, if the day of the month is 31 it will be considered as 30.

* If @method is 0 or omitted, the XL US method will be used. This is a somewhat complicated industry standard method where the last day of February is considered to be the 30th day of the month, but only for the first date.
* If @method is 2, a saner version of the US method is used in which both dates get the same February treatment.
* Note that Gnumeric will perform regular string to serial number conversion for you, so you can enter a date as a string.
* This function is mostly Excel compatible.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EDATUM liefert die Seriennummer des Datums, das die angegebene Anzahl von Monaten vor oder nach dem angegebenen Datum liegt. @Datum ist die Seriennummer des Anfangsdatums und @Monate ist die Anzahl von Monaten vor (negative Zahl) oder nach (positive Zahl) dem Anfangsdatum.
* Falls @Monate keine Ganzzahl ist, werden die Nachkommastellen abgeschnitten.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EOMONTH returns the last day of the month which is @months from the @start_date.
* EOMONTH returns #NUM! if @start_date or @months are invalid.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: If A1 contains 12/21/00 then EOMONTH(A1,0)=12/31/00, EOMONTH(A1,5)=5/31/01, and EOMONTH(A1,2)=2/28/01

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: STUNDE konvertiert eine Seriennummer in eine Stunde, wobei die Stunde als Ganzzahl im Bereich zwischen 0 und 23 definiert ist.
* Beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISOWEEKNUM returns the ISO 8601 week number of @date.

An ISO 8601 week starts on Monday. Weeks are numbered from 1. A week including days from two different years is assigned to the year which includes the most days. This means that Dec 31 could be in week 1 of the following year, and Jan 1 could be in week 52 or 53 of the previous year. ISOWEEKNUM returns the week number.
* ISOWEEKNUM returns #NUM! if date is invalid.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISOYEAR returns the year of the ISO 8601 week number of @date.

An ISO 8601 week starts on Monday. Weeks are numbered from 1. A week including days from two different years is assigned to the year which includes the most days. This means that Dec 31 could be in week 1 of the following year, and Jan 1 could be in week 52 or 53 of the previous year. ISOYEAR returns the year the week is assigned to.
* ISOYEAR returns #NUM! if date is invalid.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MINUTE konvertiert eine Seriennummer in eine Minute, wobei die Minute wird als Ganzzahl im Bereich zwischen 0 und 59 definiert ist.
* Beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MONAT konvertiert eine Seriennummer in einen Monat.
* Bitte beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NETWORKDAYS returns the number of non-weekend non-holidays between @start_date and @end_date including these dates. Holidays are optionally supplied in @holidays.
* NETWORKDAYS returns #NUM! if @start_date or @end_date are invalid.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: JETZT liefert die Datumsseriennummer für den Zeitpunkt, an diese Funktion ausgewertet wird.

Datumsseriennummern in Gnumeric sind wie folgt aufgebaut: Der ganzzahlige Bestandteil ist die Anzahl der Tage seit dem 1. Januar 1900. Der gebrochene Anteil repräsentiert den Bruchteil des Tages bestehend aus den Stunden-, Minuten- und Sekunden-Anteilen.
* .0 steht für den Tagesbeginn und 0.5 den Mittag.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SEKUNDE konvertiert eine Seriennummer in eine Sekunde, wobei die Sekunde als Ganzzahl im Bereich zwischen 0 und 59 definiert ist.
* Beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergegeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ZEITWERT liefert die Tageszeit als Dezimalzahl zwischen 0 und 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HEUTE liefert die heutige Datumsseriennummer, also die Anzahl der Tage, die seit dem 1. Januar 1900 vergangen sind.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: UNIXINDATUM konvertiert eine Unix-Zeit in ein für die Tabellenkalkulation lesbares Datums- und Zeitformat.
* Die Unix-Zeit ist die Anzahl der Sekunden seit Mitternacht des 1. Januars 1970.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: WOCHENTAG konvertiert eine Seriennummer in einen Wochentag.
Diese Funktion liefert eine Ganzzahl, die den Wochentag angibt.
@Methode legt die Art des Zählens fest. Die Vorgabe ist 1.
Für @Methode=1: Sonntag ist 1, Montag ist 2, u.s.w.
Für @Methode=2: Montag ist 1, Dienstag ist 2, u.s.w.
Für @Methode=3: Montag ist 0, Dienstag ist 1, u.s.w.
* Beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: WEEKNUM returns the week number of @date according to the given @method.
For @method=1, week starts on Sunday, and days before first Sunday are in week 0.
For @method=2, week starts on Monday, and days before first Monday are in week 0.
For @method=150, the ISO 8601 week number is returned.
* WEEKNUM returns #NUM! if @date or @method is invalid.
* This function is Excel compatible, except that Excel does not support ISO 8601 week numbers.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: WORKDAY returns the date which is @days working days from the @start_date. Weekends and holidays optionally supplied in @holidays are respected.
* WORKDAY returns #NUM! if @start_date or @days are invalid.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: JAHR konvertiert eine Seriennummer in ein Jahr.
* Beachten Sie, dass Gnumeric eine Zeichenkette automatisch in eine Seriennummer umwandelt, sodass das Datum als Zeichenkette übergeben werden kann.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YEARFRAC returns the number of full days between @start_date and @end_date according to the @basis.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BESSELI function returns the Neumann, Weber or Bessel function.
@x is where the function is evaluated. @y is the order of the Bessel function, if non-integer it is truncated.
* If @x or @y are not numeric a #VALUE! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BESSELJ function returns the Bessel function with @x is where the function is evaluated. @y is the order of the Bessel function, if non-integer it is truncated.
* If @x or @y are not numeric a #VALUE! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BESSELK function returns the Neumann, Weber or Bessel function. @x is where the function is evaluated. @y is the order of the Bessel function, if non-integer it is truncated.
* If @x or @y are not numeric a #VALUE! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BESSELY function returns the Neumann, Weber or Bessel function.
@x is where the function is evaluated. @y is the order of the Bessel function, if non-integer it is truncated.
* If @x or @y are not numeric a #VALUE! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BININDEZ wandelt eine Binärzahl in ihr dezimales Äquivalent um.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BININHEX wandelt eine Binärzahl ihr hexadezimale Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert BININHEX einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BININOKT wandelt eine Binärzahl in ihr oktales Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert BININOKT einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: KONVERTIEREN konvertiert einen Wert von einer Maßeinheit in eine andere. Sie können zum Beispiel ein Gewicht in Pfund in ein Gewicht in Gramm umwandeln. @Anzahl ist die Menge, die konvertiert werden soll, @Ausgangseinheit legt die Einheit des Wertes @Anzahl fest und @Zieleinheit ist die Einheit des Ergebnisses.
@Ausgangseinheit und @Zieleinheit können eines der folgenden sein:
Für Metrische Einheiten kann eines der folgenden Präfixe verwendet werden:
* Falls @Ausgangseinheit und @Zieleinheit unterschiedlichen Kategorien angehören, liefert KONVERTIEREN einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DEZINBIN wandelt eine Dezimalzahl ihr binäres Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert DEZINBIN einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DEZINHEX wandelt eine Dezimalzahl in ihr hexadezimales Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert DEZINHEX einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DEZINOKT wandelt eine Dezimalzahl in ihr dezimales Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert DEZINOKT einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DELTA überprüft die beiden Argumente @x und @y auf numerische Äquivalenz, wobei im Falle der Gleichwertigkeit 1 geliefert wird..
* @y ist optional, und die Vorgabe ist 0.
* Falls eines der Argumente keine Zahl ist, liefert DELTA einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FEHLERF liefert die Fehlerfunktion, die definiert ist als:
erf(x) = 2/sqrt(pi)* integral von 0 nach x von exp(-t*t) dt.
Falls zwei Argumente übergegeben werden, werden sie als limes inferior und superior des Integrals verwendet.
* Falls @limes_inferior oder @limes_superior nicht numerisch sind, liefert FEHLERF einen #WERT!-Fehler.
* Diese Version ist abwärts-kompatibel zu Excel. (Falls zwei Argumente übergeben werden, darf bei Excel keines der beiden negativ sein.)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FEHLERFK liefert die komplementäre Fehlerfunktion, die definiert ist als:
erfc(x) wird für Argumente, die ungefähr größer als 0.5 sind, exakter als 1 - erf(x) berechnet.
* Falls @x nicht numerisch ist, liefert FEHLERFK einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GESTEP vergleicht @x und @y und liefert 1, falls @x >= @y, andernfalls 0. @y ist optional und die Vorgabe ist 0.
* Falls eines der Argumente nicht numerisch ist, liefert GESTEP einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HEXINBIN wandelt eine hexadezimale Zahl ihr binäres Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert HEXINBIN einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HEXINDEZ wandelt eine hexadezimale Zahl in ihr dezimales Äquivalent um.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HEXINOKT wandelt eine hexadezimale Zahl in ihr oktales Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert HEXINOKT einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OKTINBIN wandelt eine oktale Zahl in ihr binäres Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert OKTINBIN einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OKTINDEZ wandelt eine oktale Zahl in ihr dezimales Äquivalent um.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OKTINHEX wandelt eine oktale Zahl in ihr hexadezimales Äquivalent um. @Stellen ist ein optionales Argument, wodurch eventuelle leere Stellen mit Nullen aufgefüllt werden, bis die Zahl @Stellen lang ist.
* Falls @Stellen zu klein oder negativ ist, liefert OKTINHEX einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ACCRINT calculates the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest.

@issue is the issue date of the security. @first_interest is the first interest date of the security. @settlement is the settlement date of the security. The settlement date is always after the issue date (the date when the security is bought). @rate is the annual rate of the security and @par is the par value of the security. @frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @issue date, @first_interest date, or @settlement date is not valid, ACCRINT returns #NUM! error.
* The dates must be @issue < @first_interest < @settlement, or ACCRINT returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @issue date is after @settlement date or they are the same, ACCRINT returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ACCRINTM calculates and returns the accrued interest for a security from @issue to @maturity date.

@issue is the issue date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @rate is the annual rate of the security and @par is the par value of the security. If you omit @par, ACCRINTM applies $1,000 instead. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @issue date or @maturity date is not valid, ACCRINTM returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @issue date is after @maturity date or they are the same, ACCRINTM returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AMORDEGRC: Calculates depreciation for each accounting period using French accounting conventions. Assets purchased in the middle of a period take prorated depreciation into account. This is similar to AMORLINC, except that a depreciation coefficient is applied in the calculation depending on the life of the assets.
@purchase_date The date the asset was purchased.
@first_period The end of the first period.
@rate rate of depreciation as a percentage.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AMORLINC: Calculates depreciation for each accounting period using French accounting conventions. Assets purchased in the middle of a period take prorated depreciation into account.
@purchase_date The date the asset was purchased.
@first_period The end of the first period.
@rate rate of depreciation as a percentage.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPDAYBS returns the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@eom = TRUE handles end of month maturity dates special.
Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly, 6 = bimonthly, 12 = monthly.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
(See the gnumeric manual for a detailed description of these bases).
* If @frequency is invalid, COUPDAYBS returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is invalid, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPDAYS returns the number of days in the coupon period of the settlement date.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@eom = TRUE handles end of month maturity dates special.
Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly, 6 = bimonthly, 12 = monthly.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
(See the gnumeric manual for a detailed description of these bases).
* If @frequency is invalid, COUPDAYS returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is invalid, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPDAYSNC returns the number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon date.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@eom = TRUE handles end of month maturity dates special.
Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly, 6 = bimonthly, 12 = monthly.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
(See the gnumeric manual for a detailed description of these bases).
* If @frequency is invalid, COUPDAYSNC returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is invalid, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPNCD returns the coupon date following settlement.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@eom = TRUE handles end of month maturity dates special.
Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly, 6 = bimonthly, 12 = monthly.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
(See the gnumeric manual for a detailed description of these bases).
* If @frequency is invalid, COUPNCD returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is invalid, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPNUM returns the numbers of coupons to be paid between the settlement and maturity dates, rounded up.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@eom = TRUE handles end of month maturity dates special.
Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. 6 = bimonthly, 12 = monthly.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, 4, 6 or 12, COUPNUM returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 5, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: COUPPCD returns the coupon date preceding settlement.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year.
@eom = TRUE handles end of month maturity dates special.
Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly, 6 = bimonthly, 12 = monthly.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
(See the gnumeric manual for a detailed description of these bases).
* If @frequency is invalid, COUPPCD returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is invalid, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: KUMBIVNORMVERT berechnet die kumulative bivariate Normalverteilung aus den Parametern a, b und Rho. Der gelieferte Wert ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass zwei Zufallsvariablen mit der Korrelaion @Rho jeweils kleiner als @a und @b sind.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GESZINSZ liefert die Zinsaufwendung für ein Darlehen zwischen @Periode_Beginn und @Periode_Ende.
* Falls @Typ <> 0 und @Typ <> 1 ist, liefert GESZINSZ einen #ZAHL!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GESZINSK liefert die Kapitalaufwendung für ein Darlehen zwischen @Periode_Beginn und @Periode_Ende.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DB calculates the depreciation of an asset for a given period using the fixed-declining balance method. @cost is the initial value of the asset. @salvage is the value after the depreciation.
@life is the number of periods overall. @period is the period for which you want the depreciation to be calculated. @month is the number of months in the first year of depreciation.
* If @month is omitted, it is assumed to be 12.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DDB returns the depreciation of an asset for a given period using the double-declining balance method or some other similar method you specify.

@cost is the initial value of the asset, @salvage is the value after the last period, @life is the number of periods, @period is the period for which you want the depreciation to be calculated, and @factor is the factor at which the balance declines.
* If @factor is omitted, it is assumed to be two (double-declining balance method).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DISC calculates and returns the discount rate for a security. @settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security. @par is the price per $100 face value of the security. @redemption is the redeption value per $100 face value of the security.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @settlement date or @maturity date is not valid, DISC returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @settlement date is after @maturity date or they are the same, DISC returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DOLLARDE converts a dollar price expressed as a fraction into a dollar price expressed as a decimal number.
@fractional_dollar is the fractional number to be converted. @fraction is the denominator of the fraction.
* If @fraction is non-integer it is truncated.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DOLLARBRUCH konvertiert einen als Bruch in einen als Dezimalzahl ausgedrückten Dollarpreis.
@Gebrochener_Dollar ist die zu konvertierende Bruchzahl. @Bruch ist der Nenner des Bruches.
* Falls @Bruch keine Ganzzahl ist, werden die Nachkommastellen abgeschnitten.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DURATION calculates the duration of a security.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security.
@maturity is the maturity date of the security.
@coup The annual coupon rate as a percentage.
@yield The annualized yield of the security as a percentage.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, DURATION returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EFFEKTIV liefert den Effektivzinssatz eines angegebenen nominalen Zinssatzes.
Der Effektivzinssatz mit folgender Formel berechnet:
@r = nominal interest rate (stated in yearly terms)
@nper = number of periods used for compounding

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Kreditkarten verzeichnen eine jährliche Gesamtbelastung, die ein nominaler Zinssatz ist..
Wollen Sie beispielsweise herausfinden, wie viele Zinsen Sie für Ihre Kreditkarte mit einer jährlichen Gesamtbelastung von 19%, die monatlich verzinst wird, zahlen, so müssen Sie folgendes eingeben:
liefert .2075 oder 20.75%. Dies ist der effektive Anteil, den Sie auf Ihre Anleihe Zahlen müssen.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EURO converts one Euro to a given national currency in the European monetary union.
* If the given @currency is other than one of the above, EURO returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EUROCONVERT converts the currency value @n of @source currency to a target currency @target. Both currencies are given as three-letter strings using the ISO code system names. The following currencies are available:
* If the given @source or @target is other than one of the above, EUROCONVERT returns #VALUE! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FV computes the future value of an investment. This is based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate. The interest rate per period is @rate, @nper is the number of periods in an annuity, @pmt is the payment made each period, @pv is the present value and @type is when the payment is made.
* If @type = 1 then the payment is made at the beginning of the period.
* If @type = 0 it is made at the end of each period.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FVSCHEDULE returns the future value of given initial value after applying a series of compound periodic interest rates. The argument @principal is the present value; @schedule is an array of interest rates to apply. The @schedule argument must be a range of cells.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Let us assume that the cells A1, A2, ..., A5 contain interest rates 0.11, 0.13, 0.09, 0.17, and 0.03. Then

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: G_DURATION calculates number of periods needed for an investment to attain a desired value. This function is similar to FV and PV with a difference that we do not need give the direction of cash flows e.g. -100 for a cash outflow and +100 for a cash inflow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: INTRATE calculates and returns the interest rate of a fully vested security.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @investment is the prize of the security paid at @settlement date and @redemption is the amount to be received at @maturity date.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @settlement date or @maturity date is not valid, INTRATE returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @settlement date is after @maturity date or they are the same, INTRATE returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: If you had a bond with a settlement date of April 15, 2000, maturity date September 30, 2000, investment of $100,000, redemption value $103,525, using the actual/actual basis, the bond discount rate is:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IPMT calculates the amount of a payment of an annuity going towards interest.
PRINCIPAL(PER-1) = amount of the remaining principal from last period
* If @fv is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.
* If @type is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IRR calculates and returns the internal rate of return of an investment. This function is closely related to the net present value function (NPV). The IRR is the interest rate for a series of cash flows where the net preset value is zero.

@values contains the series of cash flows generated by the investment. The payments should occur at regular intervals. The optional @guess is the initial value used in calculating the IRR. You do not have to use that, it is only provided for the Excel compatibility.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Let us assume that the cells A1:A8 contain the numbers -32432, 5324, 7432, 9332, 12324, 4334, 1235, -3422. Then

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ZINSZAHLUNG liefert den in einer bestimmten Periode gezahlten Zins.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MDURATION returns the Macauley duration for a security with par value 100.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @settlement or @maturity are not valid dates, MDURATION returns #NUM! error.
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, MDURATION returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, MSRB 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: MIZS liefert den modifizierten internen Zinssatz für einen angegebenen periodischen Zinsfluss.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NOMINAL liefert den nominalen Zinssatz einer angegebenen Effektivverzinsung.
Der nominale Zinssatz wird mit folgender Formel berechnet:
@nper = number of periods used for compounding

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NPER calculates number of periods of an investment based on periodic constant payments and a constant interest rate.

The interest rate per period is @rate, @pmt is the payment made each period, @pv is the present value, @fv is the future value and @type is when the payments are due. If @type = 1, payments are due at the beginning of the period, if @type = 0, payments are due at the end of the period.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: For example, if you deposit $10,000 in a savings account that earns an interest rate of 6%. To calculate home many years it will take to double your investment use NPER as follows:
=NPER(0.06, 0, -10000, 20000,0)returns 11.895661046 which indicates that you can double your money just before the end of the 12th year.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NPV calculates the net present value of an investment generating periodic payments. @rate is the periodic interest rate and @v1, @v2, ... are the periodic payments. If the schedule of the cash flows are not periodic use the XNPV function.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDFPRICE returns the price per $100 face value of a security. The security should have an odd short or long first period.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @issue is the issue date of the security. @frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, ODDFPRICE returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDFYIELD calculates the yield of a security having an odd first period.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, ODDFYIELD returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDLPRICE calculates the price per $100 face value of a security that has an odd last coupon period.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, ODDLPRICE returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODDLYIELD calculates the yield of a security having an odd last period.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, ODDLYIELD returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BAW_AMER models the theoretical price of an option according to the Barone Adesie & Whaley approximation.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike is the strike price at which the option is struck
@time is the number of days to maturity of the option
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BJERSTENS models the theoretical price of american options according to the Bjerksund & Stensland approximation technique.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike is the strike price at which the option is struck
@time is the number of days to maturity of the option
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the price of a European option using call_put_flag, @call_put_flag, c or p struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
@time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset or the period through to the exercise date.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
* The returned value will be expressed in the same units as @strike and @spot.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_CARRYCOST uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the "elasticity" of a European option struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
(The elasticity of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to its cost of carry.)
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset for the period through to the exercise date. @time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@rate is the risk-free interest rate to the exercise date, in percent.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield.
* The returned value will be expressed as the rate of change of option value, per 100% volatility.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_DELTA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the "delta" of a European option with call_put_flag, @call_put_flag, c or p struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
Where @time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset or the period through to the exercise date.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
* The returned value will be expressed in the same units as @strike and @spot.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_GAMMA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the "gamma" of a European option struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
(The gamma of an option is the second derivative of its price with respect to the price of the underlying asset, and is the same for calls and puts.)
@time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@rate is the risk-free interest rate to the exercise date, in percent.
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset for the period through to the exercise date.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
* The returned value will be expressed as the rate of change of delta per unit change in @spot.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_RHO uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the "rho" of a European option with call_put_flag, @call_put_flag struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put.
(The rho of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to the risk free interest rate.)
@time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@rate is the risk-free interest rate to the exercise date, in percent.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
* The returned value will be expressed as the rate of change of option value, per 100% change in @rate.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_THETA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the "theta" of a European option with call_put_flag, @call_put_flag struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
(The theta of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to time to expiry.)
@time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
and @rate is the risk-free interest rate to the exercise date, in percent.
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset for the period through to the exercise date.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
* The returned value will be expressed as minus the rate of change of option value, per 365.25 days.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_BS_VEGA uses the Black-Scholes model to calculate the "vega" of a European option struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
(The vega of an option is the rate of change of its price with respect to volatility, and is the same for calls and puts.)
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset for the period through to the exercise date.
@time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@rate is the risk-free interest rate to the exercise date, in percent.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield.
* The returned value will be expressed as the rate of change of option value, per 100% volatility.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_COMPLEX_CHOOSER models the theoretical price of complex chooser options.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike_call is the strike price at which the option is struck
@strike_put is the strike price at which the option is struck
@time is the time in years until the holder chooses a put or a call option
@time_call is the time in years to maturity of the call option if chosen
@time_put is the time in years to maturity of the put option if chosen
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_EXEC models the theoretical price of executive stock options @call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
One would expect this to always be a call option
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike is the strike price at which the option is struck
@time is the number of days to maturity of the option
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
@lambda is the jump rate for executives. The model assumes executives forfeit their options if they leave the company.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_EXTENDIBLE_WRITER models the theoretical price of extendible writer options. These are options that can be exercised at an initial period, @time1, or their maturity extended to @time2 if the option is out of the money at @time1
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset.
@strike1 is the strike price at which the option is struck.
@strike2 is the strike price at which the option is struck.
@time1 is the initial maturity of the option in years.
@time2 is the is the extended maturity in years if chosen.
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield.
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_FORWARD_START models the theoretical price of forward start options
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@alpha is a fraction that set the strike price the future date @time1
@time1 is the number of days until the option starts
@time is the number of days to maturity of the option
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_FRENCH values the theoretical price of a European option adjusted for trading day volatility, struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
@call_put_flag is 'c' or 'p' to indicate whether the option is a call or a put.
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset for the period through to the exercise date.
@time the number of calendar days to exercise divided by calendar days in the year.
@t2 is the number of trading days to exercise divided by trading days in the year.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield to the exercise date, in percent.
* The returned value will be expressed as the rate of change of option value, per 100% volatility.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_GARMAN_KOHLHAGEN values the theoretical price of a European currency option struck at @strike on an asset with spot price @spot.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@volatility is the annualized volatility, in percent, of the asset for the period through to the exercise date.
@time the number of days to exercise
@domestic_rate is the domestic risk-free interest rate to the exercise date
@foreign_rate is the foreign risk-free interest rate to the exercise date, in percent.
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
* The returned value will be expressed as the rate of change of option value, per 100% volatility.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_JUMP_DIFF models the theoretical price of an option according to the Jump Diffusion process (Merton).
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying
@strike is the strike price of the option
@time is the time to maturity of the option expressed in years
@rate is the annualised rate of interest
@volatility is the annualized volatility of the underlying asset
@lambda is expected number of 'jumps' per year
@gamma is proportion of volatility explained by the 'jumps'

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_MILTERSEN_SCHWARTZ models the theoretical price of options on commodities futures according to Miltersen & Schwartz.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@p_t is a zero coupon bond with expiry at option maturity
@t1 is the time to maturity of the option
@t2 is the time to maturity of the underlying commodity futures contract
@v_s is the volatility of the spot commodity price
@v_e is the volatility of the future convenience yield
@v_f is the volatility of the forward rate of interest
@rho_se is correlation between the spot commodity price and the convenience yield
@rho_sf is correlation between the spot commodity price and the forward interest rate
@rho_ef is correlation between the forward interest rate and the convenience yield
@kappa_e is the speed of mean reversion of the convenience yield
@kappa_f is the speed of mean reversion of the forward interest rate

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_ON_OPTIONS models the theoretical price of options on options
@type_flag is 'cc' for calls on calls, 'cp' for calls on puts, and so on for 'pc', and 'pp'
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset.
@strike1 is the strike price at which the option is struck.
@strike2 is the strike price at which the option is struck.
@time1 is the time in years to maturity of the option.
@time2 is the time in years to the maturity of the underlying option.
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield
@volatility is the annualised volatility in price of the underlying

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_RGW models the theoretical price of an american option according to the Roll-Geske-Whaley approximation where:
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike is the strike price at which the option is struck
@t1 is the time to the dividend payout
@t2 is the time to option expiration.
@rate is the annualised rate of interest
@d is the amount of the dividend to be paid
@volatility is the annualized rate of volatility of the underlying asset

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_SIMPLE_CHOOSER models the theoretical price of simple chooser options.
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike is the strike price at which the option is struck
@time1 is the time in years until the holder chooses a put or a call option
@time2 is the time in years until the the chosen option expires
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OPT_TIME_SWITCH models the theoretical price of time switch options. (Pechtl 1995)
The holder receives @a * @dt for each period dt that the asset price was greater than the strike price (for a call) or below it (for a put)
@call_put_flag is c or p to indicate whether the option is a call or a put
@spot is the spot price of the underlying asset
@strike is the strike price at which the option is struck
@a is the amount received for each time period as discussed above
@time is the maturity of the option in years
@m is the number of time units the option has already met the condition
@dt is the agreed upon discrete time period (often a day) expressed as a fraction of a year
@rate is the risk annualised free rate of interest
@cost_of_carry is the leakage in value of the underlying asset, for common stocks, this would be the dividend yield

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PMT returns the amount of payment for a loan based on a constant interest rate and constant payments (each payment is equal amount).
@nper is the overall number of payments.
@type is the type of the payment: 0 means at the end of the period and 1 means at the beginning of the period.
* If @fv is omitted, Gnumeric assumes it to be zero.
* If @type is omitted, Gnumeric assumes it to be zero.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PPMT calculates the amount of a payment of an annuity going towards principal.
IPMT(per) = amount of interest for period @per
* If @fv is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.
* If @type is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PRICE returns price per $100 face value of a security. This method can only be used if the security pays periodic interest.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, PRICE returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PRICEDISC calculates and returns the price per $100 face value of a security bond. The security does not pay interest at maturity.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @discount is the rate for which the security is discounted. @redemption is the amount to be received on @maturity date.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @settlement date or @maturity date is not valid, PRICEDISC returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @settlement date is after @maturity date or they are the same, PRICEDISC returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PRICEMAT calculates and returns the price per $100 face value of a security. The security pays interest at maturity.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @issue is the issue date of the security. @rate is the discount rate of the security. @yield is the annual yield of the security. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @settlement date or @maturity date is not valid, PRICEMAT returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @settlement date is after @maturity date or they are the same, PRICEMAT returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PV calculates the present value of an investment. @rate is the periodic interest rate, @nper is the number of periods used for compounding. @pmt is the payment made each period, @fv is the future value and @type is when the payment is made.
* If @type = 1 then the payment is made at the beginning of the period.
* If @type = 0 (or omitted) it is made at the end of each period.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ZINS liefert den Zinssatz einer Investition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: RECEIVED calculates and returns the amount to be received at maturity date for a security bond.
@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. The amount of investment is specified in @investment. @rate is the security's discount rate.
@basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @settlement date or @maturity date is not valid, RECEIVED returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @settlement date is after @maturity date or they are the same, RECEIVED returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SLN function will determine the straight line depreciation of an asset for a single period.
@cost is the cost of an asset when acquired (market value).
@salvage_value is the amount you get when asset is sold at the end of the asset's useful life.
@life is the anticipated life of an asset.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: For example, lets suppose your company purchases a new machine for $10,000, which has a salvage value of $700 and will have a useful life of 10 years. The SLN yearly depreciation is computed as follows:
This will return the yearly depreciation figure of $930.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: SYD function calculates the sum-of-years digits depreciation for an asset based on its cost, salvage value, anticipated life and a particular period. This method accelerates the rate of the depreciation, so that more depreciation expense occurs in earlier periods than in later ones. The depreciable cost is the actual cost minus the salvage value. The useful life is the number of periods (typically years) over with the asset is depreciated.
The Formula used for sum-of-years digits depreciation is:
@cost is the cost of an asset when acquired (market value).
@salvage_value is the amount you get when asset sold at the end of its useful life.
@life is the anticipated life of an asset.
@period is the period for which we need the expense.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: For example say a company purchases a new computer for $5000 which has a salvage value of $200, and a useful life of five years. We would use the following to calculate the second year's depreciation using the SYD method:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TBILLEQ function returns the bond-yield equivalent (BEY) for a treasury bill. TBILLEQ is equivalent to
where DSM is the days between @settlement and @maturity.
* If @settlement is after @maturity or the @maturity is set to over one year later than the @settlement, TBILLEQ returns #NUM! error.
* If @discount is negative, TBILLEQ returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TBILLPRICE function returns the price per $100 value for a treasury bill where @settlement is the settlement date and @maturity is the maturity date of the bill. @discount is the treasury bill's discount rate.
* If @settlement is after @maturity or the @maturity is set to over one year later than the @settlement, TBILLPRICE returns #NUM! error.
* If @discount is negative, TBILLPRICE returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TBILLYIELD function returns the yield for a treasury bill. @settlement is the settlement date and @maturity is the maturity date of the bill. @discount is the treasury bill's discount rate.
* If @settlement is after @maturity or the @maturity is set to over one year later than the @settlement, TBILLYIELD returns #NUM! error.
* If @pr is negative, TBILLYIELD returns #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: VDB calculates the depreciation of an asset for a given period or partial period using the double-declining balance method.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: XIRR calculates and returns the internal rate of return of an investment that has not necessarily periodic payments. This function is closely related to the net present value function (NPV and XNPV). The XIRR is the interest rate for a series of cash flows where the XNPV is zero.

@values contains the series of cash flows generated by the investment. @dates contains the dates of the payments. The first date describes the payment day of the initial payment and thus all the other dates should be after this date. The optional @guess is the initial value used in calculating the XIRR. You do not have to use that, it is only provided for the Excel compatibility.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Let us assume that the cells A1:A5 contain the numbers -6000, 2134, 1422, 1933, and 1422, and the cells B1:B5 contain the dates "1999-01-15", "1999-04-04", "1999-05-09", "2000-03-12", and "2000-05-1". Then

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: XNPV calculates the net present value of an investment. The schedule of the cash flows is given in @dates array. The first date indicates the beginning of the payment schedule. @rate is the interest rate and @values are the payments.
* If @values and @dates contain unequal number of values, XNPV returns the #NUM! error.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YIELD returns the yield on a security that pays periodic interest.
@frequency is the number of coupon payments per year. Allowed frequencies are: 1 = annual, 2 = semi, 4 = quarterly. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, YIELD returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YIELDDISC calculates the annual yield of a security that is discounted.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @pr is the price per $100 face value of the security. @redemption is the redemption value per $100 face value. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @frequency is other than 1, 2, or 4, YIELDDISC returns #NUM! error.
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: YIELDMAT calculates the annual yield of a security for which the interest is payed at maturity date.

@settlement is the settlement date of the security. @maturity is the maturity date of the security. @issue is the issue date of the security. @rate is the interest rate set to the security. @pr is the price per $100 face value of the security. @basis is the type of day counting system you want to use:
* If @basis is omitted, US 30/360 is applied.
* If @basis is not in between 0 and 4, #NUM! error is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GNUMERIC_VERSION liefert die Gnumeric-Version als Zeichenkette.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CELL returns information about the formatting, location, or contents of a cell.
@type specifies the type of information you want to obtain:
address Returns the given cell reference as text.
col Returns the number of the column in @ref.
contents Returns the contents of the cell in @ref.
format Returns the code of the format of the cell.
parentheses Returns 1 if @ref contains a negative value
and its format displays it with parentheses.
row Returns the number of the row in @ref.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Cell("format",A1) returns the code of the format of the cell A1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ANZAHLLEEREZELLEN liefert die Anzahl leerer Zellen in @Bereich.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: ANZAHLLEEREZELLEN(A1:A20) liefert die Anzahl leerer Zellen in A1:A20.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ERROR.TYP liefert eine Fehlernummer, die dem angegebenen Fehlerwert @Wert entspricht. Die Fehlernummern für die Fehlerwerte sind:

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: EXPRESSION returns expression in @cell as a string, or empty if the cell is not an expression.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: entering '=EXPRESSION(A3)' in A2 = empty (assuming there is nothing in A3).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: UMGEBUNG.ZUORDNEN ermittelt den Wert einer der beim Ausführen verwendeten Umgebungsvariable.
* Falls die von der Zeichenkette @Zeichenkette angegebene Variable nicht existiert, liefert UMGEBUNG.ZUORDNEN einen #NV!-Fehler.
* Beachten Sie, dass bei Variablennamen zwischen Groß- und Kleinschreibung unterschieden wird.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: INFO liefert Informationen zur aktuellen Arbeitsumgebung.
@Typ ist der Informationstyp, den Sie erhalten möchten:
memavail Liefert den freien Speicher in Bytes.
memused Liefert den freien Speicher in Bytes.
numfile Liefert die Anzahl geöffneter Arbeitsbücher.
osversion Liefert die Version des Betriebssystems.
recalc Liefert den Modus für die Neuberechnungs (automatisch).
release Liefert die verwendete Gnumeric-Version als Text.
totmem Liefert den verfügbaren Gesamtspeicher in Bytes.
* Diese Funktion ist Excel-kompatibel, außer dass die Typen »directory« und »origin« nicht implementiert sind.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTLEER liefert WAHR, falls @Wert leer ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTFEHL liefert WAHR, falls der Wert irgendein Fehler außer #NV ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTFEHLER liefert WAHR, falls der Ausdruck einen Fehler enthält.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTGERADE liefert WAHR, falls @Zahl gerade ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTLOG liefert WAHR, falls @Wert ein logischer Wert ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTNV liefert WAHR, falls der Wert der #NV-Fehlerwert ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTKTEXT liefert WAHR, falls @Wert kein Text ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTZAHL liefert WAHR, falls @Wert eine Zahl ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTUNGERADE liefert WAHR, falls @Zahl ungerade ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTBEZUG liefert WAHR, falls der Wert ein Bezug ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ISTTEXT liefert WAHR, falls der Wert ein Text ist.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: N wandelt @Wert in eine Zahl um. Zeichenketten, die Text enthalten, werden in den Wert Null umgewandelt.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TYP liefert eine Zahl, die den Datentyp von @Wert anzeigt.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: UND stellt die logische UND-Verknüpfung bereit: Das Ergebnis ist WAHR, falls alle Ausdrücke WAHR sind, andernfalls FALSCH.
@b1 bis @bN sind die auszuwertenden Ausdrücke. Falls ein ganzzahliger oder Fließpunkt-Wert übergeben wird, wird für den Wert Null FALSCH, für alle anderen WAHR angenommen.
* Falls die Werte Zeichenketten oder leere Zellen enthalten, werden diese Werte ignoriert.
* Falls keine logischen Werte übergeben werden, liefert UND einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: Angenommen, die Zelle A1 enthält 5 und A2 1. Dann liefert

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FALSCH liefert den Boole'schen Wert FALSCH.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: IF function can be used to evaluate conditionally other expressions. IF evaluates @condition. If @condition returns a non-zero value the result of the IF expression is the @if-true expression, otherwise IF evaluates to the value of @if-false.
* If omitted @if-true defaults to TRUE and @if-false to FALSE.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: NICHT stellt die logische NICHT-Verknüpfung bereit: Das Ergebnis ist WAHR, falls der Wert von @Zahl Null ist, andernfalls FALSCH.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ODER stellt die logische ODER-Verknüpfung bereit: Das Ergebnis ist WAHR, falls einer der übergebenen Werte WAHR ist.
@b1 bis @bN sind die auszuwertenden Ausdrücke. Falls ein ganzzahliger oder Fließpunkt-Wert übergeben wird, wird für den Wert Null FALSCH, für alle anderen WAHR angenommen.
* Falls die Werte Zeichenketten oder leere Zellen enthalten, werden diese Werte ignoriert.
* Falls keine logischen Werte übergeben werden, liefert ODER einen #WERT!-Fehler.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: WAHR liefert den Boole'schen Wert WAHR.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: XOR implements the logical exclusive OR function: the result is TRUE if an odd number of the values evaluated to TRUE.
@b1 trough @bN are expressions that should evaluate to TRUE or FALSE. If an integer or floating point value is provided, zero is considered FALSE and anything else is TRUE.
* If the values contain strings or empty cells those values are ignored.
* If no logical values are provided, then the error #VALUE! is returned.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ADDRESS returns a cell address as text for specified row and column numbers.
@a1 is a logical value that specifies the reference style. If @a1 is TRUE or omitted, ADDRESS returns an A1-style reference, i.e. $D$4. Otherwise ADDRESS returns an R1C1-style reference, i.e. R4C4.
@text specifies the name of the worksheet to be used as the external reference.
* If @abs_num is 1 or omitted, ADDRESS returns absolute reference.
* If @abs_num is 2 ADDRESS returns absolute row and relative column.
* If @abs_num is 3 ADDRESS returns relative row and absolute column.
